document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

bibRefCitation.author: Gory, H. L. & Percheron, A. R.
bibRefCitation.journalOrPublisher: J. B. Bailliere Librairie, Paris & London
bibRefCitation.refString: Gory, H. L. & Percheron, A. R. (1833) Monographie des cetoines et genres voisins, formant, dans les familles naturelles de Latreille, la division des scarabees melitophiles. J. B. Bailliere Librairie, Paris & London, 410 pp.
bibRefCitation.title: Monographie des cetoines et genres voisins, formant, dans les familles naturelles de Latreille, la division des scarabees melitophiles

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Paragymnetis chalcipes
G. & P.
subsp. chalcipes G. & P.
:
Schürhoff 1937: 67
(new combination; distribution);
Blackwelder 1944: 263
(catalog; distribution).

Gymnetina chalcipes (G. & P.)
:
Korytkowski & Ojeda 1970: 77
(catalog; distribution).

Gymnetina ( Gymnetoides ) chalcipes chalcipes
(G. & P., 1833):
Monné 1970: 61
(references).

Paragymnetis chalcipes ( Gory & Percheron, 1833 )
:
Silva et al. 1968: 555
(distribution; natural history);
Morelli 2000: 155–165
(distribution; larva);
Navarrete-Heredia 2001: 427
(distribution; natural history; references).

Paragymnetis litigiosa
, not Gory & Percheron, 1833 :
Di Iorio 2003: 179
(distribution; natural history): misidentification.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution:
PERU
: Amazonas : Bagua, [MELP],
identified by Pereyra 1970 ( Korytkowski & Ojeda 1970 ).
BRAZIL
( Dejean 1833 , Gory & Percheron 1833 , Schenkling 1921 ):
Río Grande do Sul
: [locality not stated] (
Silva et al. 1968
).
ARGENTINA
( Schenkling 1921 , Krajčík 1998 ):
Corrientes
( Blanchard 1850 );
Buenos Aires
: La Plata, in Bruch Collection ( Bruch 1911a ); [Pdo. Berisso], Los Talas, near La Plata ( Bruch 1919 ); Punta Lara, 20-II-[1927], Maldonado Bruzzone leg., 4 exx., identified by Bruch ( Maldonado Bruzzone 1927 ); Buenos Aires ( Bruch 1929 ); ( Schenkling 1921 , Blackwelder 1944 ); Florencio Varela ( Di Iorio 2003 ).
URUGUAY
: [locality not stated] ( Monné 1970 );
Lavalleja
: Route 8, km 120, near “La Fuente Salus” ( Morelli 2000 );
Canelones
: Sauce ( Morelli 2000 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 44–51. General aspects of Gymnetini from Argentina: 44–45,
Gymnetis chalcipes
(44, common phenotype; 45, light phenotype); 46,
Gymnetis litigiosa
(La Rioja: Los Molinos); 47–48,
Gymnetis hepatica
(47, paratype, Santiago del Estero: Sachayoj; 48, paratype, Chaco: Charata); 49,
Gymnetis undata
(Misiones, Bruch Collection); 50,
Gymnetis hebraica
; 51,
M. insculpta
.

Note:
Gymnetis chalcipes
may be distinguished by the cupreous shine on the lateral and anterior margin of the clypeus, tarsi, tibiae, mesosternal process, and abdominal sternites; the same reflection is brown in
G. undata
, and black in
G. litigiosa
.
